titleStmt.title: [The] wanton wenches of Wiltshire[.] Being a pleasant discourse between four young females, as they sat together in a convenient place to scatter their water, who being overheard by two young-men, occasioned the whole discovery of their discourse. Tune of, The maids a washing. This may be printed, R.P.

[The] wanton wenches of Wiltshire[.] Being a pleasant discourse between four young females, as they sat together in a convenient place to scatter their water, who being overheard by two young-men, occasioned the whole discovery of their discourse. Tune of, The maids a washing. This may be printed, R.P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Back, at the Black Boy on London-Bridge near the Draw-bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Now young batchelors all draw near ..."
Imperfect: trimmed at head with some loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
